help-file.title: PRACTICE
help-file.content:
Syntax: practice (t see a list of spells that may be scribed) practice <spell> (while holding both a spellbook and quill and resting) practice all (this will scribe all spells into the book currently held by the player if there is enough room left)
Practice is a method of scribing your spells. This is done with the help of a teacher in the room. For this to be done, you must have a spellbook and quill in hand and resting comfortably. You can then 'practice <spell>' to add a spell to your spellbook. If this command is typed without any parameters and you are in the presence of a teacher it will show your list of spells.
In the past, the practice command was also used to increase your skills. This is no longer the case on Duris, and you must use your skills in battle to improve them or by gaining levels.
